doc:
Describes the image data representation used by a . If you want to get the image from the widget, you can only get the currently-stored representation. e.g. if the returns #GTK_IMAGE_PIXBUF, then you can call but not . For empty images, you can request any storage type (call any of the "get" functions), but they will all return 

null
values.

members.doc: there is no image displayed by the widget
members.name: empty

members.doc: the widget contains a named icon. This image type was added in GTK+ 2.6
members.name: icon_name

members.doc: the widget contains a Gio.Icon. This image type was added in GTK+ 2.14
members.name: gicon

members.doc: the widget contains a #cairo_surface_t. This image type was added in GTK+ 3.10
members.name: surface

name: ImageType
